title: Teaching Assistant
text:
Being a math TA has been one of the most valuable and fulfilling parts of my college journey.
I find immense satisfaction in helping others understand complex concepts, grow confidence in problem-solving, and develop curiosity and passion in mathematics.

title: Teaching Assistant
text:
Experience
MATH 102 ‚Äì Calculus II
Mount Holyoke College | Spring 2025

Held weekly office hours and individual tutoring sessions

Graded assignments and provided feedback on 10+ quizzes

Assisted students with R, simulation studies, and interpretation of statistical results

STAT 242 ‚Äì Intermediate Statistics
Mount Holyoke College | Fall 2024

Held weekly office hours and individual tutoring sessions

Graded assignments and provided feedback on 10+ quizzes

Assisted students with R, simulation studies, and interpretation of statistical results

MATH 101 ‚Äì Calculus I
Mount Holyoke College | Spring 2024

Served as TA for a class of 24 students

Conducted over 40 hours of office hours and 1-on-1 help

Gave feedback to the professor weekly to adjust pacing and class engagement

A-Level Mathematics & Economics Vision Academy | Summer 2023

title: Teaching Assistant
text:
Notes & Materials
Here are some of the notes, visual aids, and walkthroughs I‚Äôve created during my time as a TA:

Intro to R: Basics & Data Wrangling (PDF)
Simulation Walkthrough: Central Limit Theorem (PDF)
Problem-Solving Tips for Calc I Students (PDF)

title: Teaching Assistant
text:
Thoughts
I really enjoy teaching, not only because I love math, but because I love seeing people light up when things finally make sense.
I believe teaching is a form of empathy, it is the ability to understand how someone else thinks, and help build a bridge from confusion to clarity.
I hope to continue taking on teaching and mentoring roles in my future career, wherever that path takes me.

title: Jayleen Jiang
text:
Hi there!
I‚Äôm Jialu (Jayleen) Jiang, a mathematics major at Mount Holyoke College with a passion for applied mathematics, neural network, and disease modeling. I love building bridges between data and theory, whether through simulating infectious disease dynamics, working with real-world social network data, or diving into PDEs and optimization problems.
Currently, I‚Äôm involved in multiple research projects ranging from COVID-19 modeling to EEG-based speech analysis. I‚Äôm also a Teaching Assistant at Mount Holyoke College and have graded and tutored across calculus, statistics, and computer science courses.

Current Role
Undergraduate Researcher

Mount Holyoke College Department of Mathematics & Statistics
Collaborating with Professor Ben Pittman-Polletta on network-based statistical models
EEG + mTRF analysis for speech perception (Python & MATLAB)

title: Projects
text:
A selection of projects I‚Äôm currently working on or have contributed to in the past. Each entry links to the project‚Äôs website or repository. Many of these are collaborative efforts, but I‚Äôve chosen to highlight those where I played a key role in their launch or development.

Active










movement



Software



Python tools for analysing body movements across space and time.












NeuroBlueprint



Standards



Lightweight data specification for systems neuroscience, inspired by BIDS.












brainglobe-template-builder



Software



Build unbiased anatomical templates from individual 3D brain images.












Video-based analysis of animal behaviour



Teaching



One-day workshop taught annually to neuroscience PhD students.












Running pose estimation on the SWC HPC system



Teaching



Half-day workshop taught annually to neuroscience PhD students.












afids-macaca



Software

Standards



Anatomical fiducials protocol adapted for macaques.

title: About Me
text:
Hi, I‚Äôm Jialu (Jayleen) Jiang.
I‚Äôm a junior at Mount Holyoke College, majoring in Mathematics with a deep interest in applied math, statistical inference, and disease modeling. I‚Äôm passionate about understanding the world through numbers and theory, and I‚Äôve worked on a variety of research projects spanning:
I‚Äôm also experienced in LaTeX, R, Python, MATLAB, and Java, and I‚Äôve worked as a Teaching Assistant and grader across calculus, statistics, and computer science courses.
